commodities.contract
Class Contract

java.lang.Object
  commodities.contract.Contract
public class Contract
extends Object

The Contract class represents the information for a given delivery month.

Version:
1.0
Author:
J.R. Titko
Updated:
2004.11.11

Nested Class Summary
 class Contract.LoadThread
          LoadThread loads the contract prices as a thread so the main processing can continue.

Constructor Detail

Contract

public Contract(String symbol,
                String month)
Create a new Contract with a given commodity symbol and contract month. The contract price will default to the standard margin of the commodity.

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol for the commodity
month - the trading month of this contract

                String month,
                int margin)

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol for the commodity
month - the trading month of this contract
margin - the margin in dollars

Parameters:

Returns:

getNearestPrices

public Prices getNearestPrices(Date date)
Get the closest Prices for the given date of this contract. If date has a price, then that date's prices will be returned. If date does not have prices, then the previous price closes to that date is returned.

Parameters:
date - the date to retrieve the prices for
Returns:
the nearest Prices to the date

isActualPriceDate

public boolean isActualPriceDate(Date date)
Returns if the date is an actual date or a nearest date.

Parameters:
date - the date to check
Returns:
true if actual date of prices or false if date was nearest date.

getPriceList

public Map getPriceList()
Get all of the Prices for this contract.

Returns:
the Prices of this contract.

getPriceDates

public ListIterator getPriceDates(boolean order)
Get all of the Price date keys in a ListIterator format for forwards and backwards traversal of the list. A descending (Contract.DESCENDING) list will begin at the most current date and should be traversed backwards (previous). An ascending list (Contract.ASCENDING) will begin at the earliest available date and should be traversed forwards (next). This ListIterator cannot have objects added or removed from it.

Parameters:
order - The order (ascending or decending) to return the list in.
Returns:
the ListIterator of keys.

loadPrices

private void loadPrices()
Load the prices from the database and determin the minimum and maximum prices for the contract.
